courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Technological aspects that drive the Greater Baltimore area and its surroundings by placing them in a social and economic context. Students will be able to evaluate how these technologies affect our metropolitan area's status and development by comparing our systems to the ones of other cities. Core: Metropolitan Perspectives.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Provides the foundational principles of computer hardware and IT infrastructure. Topics include electricity and circuits, PC components and organization, system performance and tuning, cloud services and virtualization.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Introduction to web systems and technologies, including the fundamentals of design, implementation, and evaluation of web-based applications including related software, databases, interfaces, and digital media. Social, ethical, and security issues related to web-based systems are also explored.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Based upon the Open Systems Interconnection Reference Model developed by the International Standards Organization. Topics include networking basics, network types and topologies, network protocols, reference models, network hardware, network applications and services, network operating systems and basic network security. Virtual lab, network management, and network simulation tools will be used.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Studies in selected foundational areas of Information Technology. May be repeated for a maximum of 6 units.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Provides foundational principles of system management along with hands-on experience with operating systems. Topics covered include file and directory management, graphical and command line user interfaces, process and thread mechanics and user management. In addition, students will install, manage and safely remove applications.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Introduction to data and information management, including the collection, organization, modeling, transformation, presentation, safety, and security of data and information.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Essentials for effective administration and maintenance of applications, operating systems and networks, including IT system documentation, policies and procedures, and the education and support of the users of these systems.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.courseTitle: LEGAL AND POLICY ISSUES IN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
courses.description: An in-depth exploration of the civil and common law issues that apply to information technology. Includes addressing the legal system, evidence rules, privacy rights, and constitutional issues related to computer crime.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Provides students with a solid foundation in scripting language concepts, focusing on developing, testing, and executing small programs in various scripting environments commonly found in industry.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Applies principles of computer networking and security, including topologies, routing protocols, virtualization, malware protection, cryptography, and disaster recovery.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Opportunity to develop knowledge and skills in information technology by working in a local computing facility with on-site and faculty supervision. May be repeated for a maximum of 6 units.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Covers gathering requirements, sourcing, evaluating, and integrating components into a single system. Also includes fundamentals of project management and interplay between IT applications and organizational processes.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Explores current trends and techniques related to Internet-based applications. Covers innovative technologies, frameworks, and foundational concepts essential for implementation.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Covers standards and methodologies for designing and analyzing enterprise architectures, including frameworks, layered architectures, and modeling processes.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Focuses on cloud computing and its role in the IT field. Introduces fundamental elements, frameworks, and standards of cloud computing with group and individual projects.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Focuses on risk management principles applied to cybersecurity, utilizing federal guidelines and regulations to manage threats effectively.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Covers assessing organizational vulnerabilities and implementing countermeasures to mitigate IT service disruptions. Focuses on creating enterprise continuity plans.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Explores advanced topics in computer networking, including wired and wireless networking, multimedia networking, and network management and security.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Data-centric approach to information management and analysis, including data standards, manipulation, and management techniques, with hands-on exploration of popular tools.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Covers network security principles, methods to detect, prevent, and mitigate network attacks, including cryptography, malware prevention, and security frameworks.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Focuses on client/server-side processing with an emphasis on design and implementation of web applications, integrating security and accessibility.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Exploration of selected areas of information technology. May be repeated for a maximum of 6 units provided a different topic is covered.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Design and implement an IT project, integrating technical and management skills to address real-world issues like cost, safety, and organizational goals.

courses.subject: ITEC
courses.description: Directed study in selected areas of IT for which no regular course is offered. Requires a proposal with defined objectives and a formal report.
